headline: Multiple Senate Democrats Slam Biden’s ‘Frightening Decision’…
sentences:
Sen. Joe Manchin from West Virginia said ending Title 42 is a “frightening decision.”
Sen. Mark Kelly, Democrat from Arizona, called it “wrong.” And Sen. Maggie Hassan from New Hampshire said the Biden administration “does not appear to be ready” for the migration surge.

The CDC said Title 42 is not necessary “considering current public health conditions and an increased availability of tools to fight COVID-19.”
Under Title 42, which was put in place in March 2020, around 2 million immigrants were expelled, as per Morning Consult.

In an effort to curb the inevitable influx of immigrants, a group of five Democrat and six Republican Senators is now expected to introduce a bill that calls on Biden to come up with a new plan to prevent the influx before Title 42 officially comes to an end.

According to the survey, 78 percent of Republicans “strongly disapproved.”
Even moderate Democrats, Biden’s base, are concerned about getting rid of Title 42 and fear an even bigger influx of immigrants flooding the US-Mexico border.

Some lawmakers are so concerned about the fallout of this move that they’re considering coming up with a bill that would force Biden to come up with a better plan for immigration, according to Time Magazine.

Of all voters surveyed, 42 percent “strongly disapproved” of Biden’s decision and 13 percent at least “somewhat disapproved.”
As you can expect, Republicans are especially critical of the move.
In an announcement this week that should surprise no one, the Biden regime said it will be ending Title 42, an immigration measure put in place by the Trump administration during the pandemic.
Democratic Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto of Nevada criticized the decision, even though she has previously signed on to letters pushing to rescind the Trump-era policy, The Hill reported.
(TeaParty.org Exclusive) – The Biden regime is doing everything in their power to make sure the numerous crises they’ve triggered never get resolved or see any improvement.

With the ending of Title 42, Biden’s approval rating will most definitely get even worse but it doesn’t appear that Biden cares about his approval rating.
The CDC, which oversees and has authority over Title 42, announced April 1 that it no longer would be enforcing the provision, starting May 23.
“This is the wrong way to do this and it will leave the administration unprepared for a surge at the border,” she said in a statement.

The announcement was delivered by the radical progressive Secretary of Homeland Security, Alejandro Mayorkas.
Sen. Raphael Warnock of Georgia has also said that, at the very least, the timing of ending Title 42 is bad.

In March, Biden’s approval rating for immigration fell again, the Center for Immigration Studies reported.
A Morning Consult/Politico survey showed that this is one of Biden’s most unpopular decisions so far.

Title 42 allows the US to stop immigrants from entering the country due to COVID health risks.
